item.title: Lords of the Fallen version 2.5 update now available
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Deadlier boss battles, "Veteran Mode" difficulty setting, and more.

Publisher CI Games and developer Hexworks have released the version 2.5 update for Soulslike action RPG Lords of the Fallen, which adds deadlier boss battles, a new “Veteran Mode” difficulty setting, and more.

Here is an overview of the update, via CI Games:

Following over 70 post-launch updates shaped by millions of players, Lords of the Fallen version 2.5 delivers the FINAL major update for the dark fantasy action RPG. Available now and free for all owners, version 2.5 adds significantly deadlier boss battles and enemies, an all-new Veteran difficulty mode, new boss weapon animations, a new armor set, and more!

  • Deadlier Bosses and Enemies – Across both Legacy and Veteran modes, bosses, mini-bosses, and regular foes have been reworked with refined combos, improved AI, faster recovery, and increased aggression for a more challenging Soulslike experience.
  • Veteran Mode: The Ultimate Challenge – Face a far deadlier trial designed for players who have mastered Mournstead with the new Veteran Mode difficulty setting. Faster transitions, new attack patterns, and heightened aggression transform familiar encounters into unpredictable battles.
  • Boss Weapons Reforged – Several iconic boss weapons now feature brand-new signature attack animations, adding fresh depth, impact, and identity to these coveted tools of war.
  • New Armor Set – Conquer Veteran Mode to earn the Veteran of the Veil warplate, a high-end armor set featuring a unique passive that boosts item drop rates.

Version 2.5 stands as the definitive final update for Lords of the Fallen. Forged through community feedback and refined through countless battles, it is our last gift to the crusaders who have walked with us through light and shadow.

Lords of the Fallen is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

item.title: Deus Ex Remastered delayed to unannounced date
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

No longer due out on February 5, 2026.

Aspyr has delayed cyberpunk immersive simulation game remake Deus Ex Remastered from its previously planned February 5, 2026 release date to an unannounced date. It will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam when it launches.

Here is the full message from Aspyr on the delay:

Thank you to the community for your feedback following the reveal of Deus Ex Remastered.

We’ve listened to what you had to say, and in order to better meet fan expectations and deliver the best possible experience for players, Deus Ex Remastered will no longer launch on February 5, 2026.

We look forward to sharing more updates with you when the time comes.

All existing preorders will be fully refunded. Thank you again for your patience and support.

item.title: Winx Club: The Magic is Back announced for PS5, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Due out in April 2026.

Publishers Maximum Entertainment and developer Iron Frog have announced Winx Club: The Magic is Back for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC (Steam). It will launch in April 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via Maximum Entertainment:

About

Winx Club: The Magic is Back captures the essence of the Winx universe, delivering an enchanting experience with a mix of magical combat, puzzle-solving, and cooperative gameplay with a friend. Play as all six members of the Winx Club, each with their own magical abilities.

Key Features

  • Play as Your Favorite Fairies – Play as all six members of the Winx Club, tailoring your experience based on your preferred character and their abilities. Freely switch between all five of the Winx while playing.
  • Explore Iconic Settings from the Winx Universe – Attend Alfea College and journey to familiar and distinct Winx locations, including The Enchanted Forest, The Coastal Cliffs, and The Desert Ruins of Red Fountain.
  • Winx Action in Your Hands – Engage in combat against fantasy creatures, where you’ll use each character’s unique magical abilities to bring peace to the lands. Upgrade spells to strengthen your fairies for even more fun.
  • Play with a Friend – With two-player local cooperative play, you and a friend can enjoy Winx Club together!
